# Stan in Linear Regression

Libraries
```{r, message=FALSE}
library(cmdstanr)
library(posterior)
library(bayesplot)
color_scheme_set("brightblue")
```

We first generate data from easy linear regression model 

```{r, message=FALSE}
gen_dat <- function(n, beta, sigma) {
  x <- rnorm(n)
  y <- 0 + beta*x + rnorm(n, 0, sigma)
  data.frame(x = x, y = y)
}
```

We visualize them
```{r, message=FALSE}
data = gen_dat(100, 3.5, 0.85)
plot(data$x, data$y)
```

## Sample from posterior

Compile model
```{r, message=FALSE}
mod <- cmdstan_model("lr.stan")
mod$print()
```

Run model
```{r, message=FALSE}
data_l <- list(N=100, y=data$y, x=data$x )
fit <- mod$sample(
  data = data_l,
  seed = 123,
  chains = 4,
  parallel_chains = 4,
  refresh = 500
)
```

Summary of data
```{r, message=FALSE}
fit$summary()
```


Posterior samples
```{r, message=FALSE}
mcmc_hist(fit$draws("beta"))
```

```{r, message=FALSE}
mcmc_hist(fit$draws("sigma"))
```
